title: Chinese Hakka (1923) Bible
title_vernacular: Ke jia jiu xin yue sheng jing
description: The Hakka Bible: Today's Taiwan Hakka Version (abbreviated as the TTHV) is a translation of the Bible in the Hakka language spoken by Protestant Christians in Taiwan. This version of the Bible was published in 1923 by the British and Foreign Bible Societies.
provider: The British and Foreign Bible Society

language.name: Hakka Chinese
language.autonym: 客家話 / 客家话 Hak-kâ-fa
language.area: Widespread with other dialects. Eastern and northeastern Guangdong greatest concentration; also in Fujian, Jiangxi, Guangxi, Hunan, and Sichuan. Also in Brunei, Canada, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, New Zealand, Panama, Singapore, South Africa, Suriname, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States.
